intro: Centradenia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapanese centradenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Centradenia chiapensis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
